bug.author: alessandrobokan
bug.summary: Matcher does not support attribute IS_SENT_START
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
When I tried to add a pattern to the spacy Matcher with the attribute IS_SENT_START gives me an error <denchmark-code>from spacy.matcher import Matcher matcher = Matcher(nlp.vocab) matcher.add("rule1", None, [{"IS_SENT_START": True, "LOWER": "hello"}]) </denchmark-code>
ValueError: [E152] The attribute None is not supported for token patterns. Please use the option validate=True with Matcher, PhraseMatcher, or EntityRuler for more details. I analysed the source-code of and I see that attr is in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/matcher/_schemas.py#L169>TOKEN_PATTERN_SCHEMA</denchmark-link> but in the file <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/attrs.pxd>attrs.pdx</denchmark-link> appears as , causing the error. This issue could be solved by adding following condition after this line <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/matcher/matcher.pyx#L674>674</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>if attr == "IS_SENT_START": attr = "SENT_START" </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 Python Version Used: 3.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.2.3 Environment Information: virtualenv
